definition: pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)

sentences.english: He took his revolver from his pocket, and I did the same.
sentences.chinese: 他從衣兜裏取出了左輪手槍，我也這麼幹了。

sentences.english: He fumbles in his hoodie pockets and finds his BlackBerry.
sentences.chinese: 他摸索着自己的上衣兜並發現了他的黑莓。

sentences.english: Each time I went to see her, my grandma would fill my pockets with sweets .
sentences.chinese: 每次我去看奶奶，她總是在我的衣兜塞滿糖果。

sentences.english: 1：He took out a bottle of wine out of his pocket, which he began to drink slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他從衣兜裏掏出一瓶酒慢慢地喝起來。

sentences.english: I walked over to the pickle jar, dug down into my pocket, and pulled out a fistful of coins.
sentences.chinese: 我走近罈子，從衣兜裏掏出一大把硬幣來。

sentences.english: He took some money from his pocket and gave it to the taxi driver.
sentences.chinese: 他從衣兜裏拿出一些錢遞給出租車司機。

sentences.english: Zadak took his gun from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 扎達克從衣兜裏掏出了槍。

definition: to fish out/to take out (from a pocket, bag etc)
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
full and bulging (of a pocket, pouch etc)
